title: Practice Exercise
description:
Build a **Student Grade Manager** that combines all loop concepts into one complete program. **Program Requirements:** - **Main Menu (while True loop)**:
  • 1. Enter grades - 2. View statistics - 3. View grade distribution - 4. Find highest/lowest - 5. Exit
    • - **Enter Grades (for loop + validation)**:
  • Ask how many students - Collect grade for each (0-100) - Validate all input - Store in a list
    • - **Statistics (accumulators)**:
  • Calculate average - Count passing (>=60) - Count failing (<60) - Show percentages
    • - **Distribution (nested loops)**:
  • Group by letter grade (A, B, C, D, F) - Display visual bar chart
    • - **High/Low (tracking)**:
  • Find highest grade and student number - Find lowest grade and student number
    • **Example Session:** 
    === Student Grade Manager ===

1. Enter grades
2. View statistics
3. View distribution
4. Find high/low
5. Exit

Choice: 1

How many students? 3

Grade for student 1: 85
Grade for student 2: 92
Grade for student 3: 78

✅ 3 grades entered!

Choice: 2

=== Statistics ===
Total students: 3
Average: 85.0
Passing: 3 (100%)
Failing: 0 (0%)

Choice: 4

=== High/Low ===
Highest: 92.0 (Student 2)
Lowest: 78.0 (Student 3)

Choice: 5

Goodbye!
    **Hints:** - Use a list to store grades: grades = [] - Use grades.append(grade) to add grades - Check if list is empty before calculations: if len(grades) > 0 - Use enumerate() to track student numbers: for i, grade in enumerate(grades, start=1)

hints.text: For validation, use 'if 0 <= grade <= 100'. For appending, use 'grades.append(grade)'. For average, divide total by len(grades). For tracking max/min, update both the value AND the student number when you find a new high/low. The enumerate(grades, start=1) gives you both index (starting at 1) and value!
